Are you passionate about music but it's not your career?

Chris Jones, whom you may know as director of instrumental music at Orrville High School, will be teaching General Music for grades 3, 4 & 5 for the coming school year. He is working on his lesson plans and contacted us with this request:

“I’d like to do Zoom interviews with 36 people from Orrville who are passionate about music, but it is not necessarily part of their job. I will then turn the interviews into mini lessons for each grade with a ‘Music in Our Community’ interview as a spotlight each week for my virtual lessons. Could you contact people you know who might be willing to participate?”

Would you be willing to have a Zoom interview with Chris?

If so, send an email to orrvillehsalumni@gmail.com and we’ll send you the interview template and will forward your email to Chris.

Thank you for considering helping a teacher and to ultimately touch young lives!

Some "yearbooks" from 1918, 1920, 1921 and 1922-23 were given to us by Jane Smucker Beyeler '65, which we will deliver to Orrville Public Library to add to their collection. Any time you would like to look at old yearbooks, you can go to the library where a full collection is kept safely under lock and key. You can't take them home, but you can enjoy them there and even snap photos of favorite pages.

The books Jane brought us belonged to her husband's grandmother, Edna Zimmerly Beyeler. They appear to be not an annual, but a bi-monthly publication. These probably evolved into what some of us remember as the Red & White, a monthly "newspaper" about things happening at OHS.

Here are some of the pages from the December 1918 edition. The ads might be of special interest to those who have been around Orrville for a good while.

Congratulations to OHS 1999 grad Thad Tillison on receiving the 11th Annual Growing Healthy Habits Champion Award at the 2019 Orrville Chamber Banquet. #oaccexperience

The Dr. Andrew Naumoff Healthy Habits Champion Award is sponsored by the Aultman Orrville Hospital Growing Healthy Habits Coalition to acknowledge and recognise the important contributions of a community member towards healthy living, healthy choices and living with good habits personally and publicly. Nominations are made by members of the community, including staff, volunteers, friends, family members or employers of the candidate. The award is $250 donation to a not-for-profit organization or charity of the recipient’s choosing.

The review board considers nominees who demonstrate the recipient’s personal devotion to being healthy, who personally or publicly work to enhance the quality of life in the Orrville community by showing evidence they live by choosing healthy habits while striving to make others in the Orrville Community healthier.

A huge thank you to those who have donated to the menstrual kits. Today Ethel and I (and my daughter Tina) were able to go to Magwero and give kits to 34 girls there. The teachers will also be receiving kits.

We had a wonderful time of sharing the Word of God, debunking myths surrounding their periods, letting them know it's nothing to be ashamed of, and why it's best to wait to have sex. They were really engaged, and so appreciative of the supplies. It was a really great morning!

We will also be doing a distribution at the Magwero School for the Blind, and also for the normal school in the village there. But we will need more supplies!

Orrville High School Alumni Association added 81 new photos — with Keith Workman.
August 6, 2018 at 7:53 PM ·

The Orrville Public Library has a complete collection of OHS Yearbooks. While doing some research, we happened upon a unique edition of the 1959 book. It had belonged to Miss Margaret Hamilton and was the year the book had been dedicated to her. We all remember signing yearbooks and may still enjoy reading the autographs in our own. But how often do you get to see once again what you wrote in someone else's book? And in this case a tribute to a very popular teacher? You may recognize some of these names or even see your own! Let's go back almost 60 years and enjoy the pages of this very special yearbook!
